item.title: US plans meeting for Gaza 'Board of Peace' in Washington on Feb 19, Axios reports
item.description:
By Kanishka Singh

WASHINGTON, Feb 6 (Reuters) - The White House is planning the first leaders meeting for President Donald Trump's so-called "Board of Peace" in relation to Gaza on February 19, Axios reported on Friday, citing a U.S. official and diplomats from four countries that are on the board.

The plans for the meeting, which would also be a fundraising conference for Gaza reconstruction, are in early stages and could still change, Axios reported.

item.title: Trump signs order threatening tariffs on nations doing business with Iran
item.description:
WASHINGTON, Feb 6 (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Friday that may impose a 25% tariff on countries that do business with Iran.

The order comes as tensions between Iran and U.S. continue to simmer even as the two countries engaged in talks this week.

(Reporting by Jasper Ward and Christian Martinez in Washington; editing by Michelle Nichols and Caitlin Webber)

item.title: France to rally aid for Lebanon as it warns truce gains remain fragile
item.description:
By Feras Dalatey

Feb 6 (Reuters) - France said on Friday that Lebanon's recovery remains precarious despite positive signs following a ceasefire and government transition, and it stood ready to support the country's reconstruction if it continues with reforms.

item.title: Factbox-Seven key Trump-Iran moments as tensions run high
item.description:
By Costas Pitas

Feb 6 (Reuters) - The United States and Iran on Friday were trying to reach a diplomatic solution to disputes between the two nations that have led to heightened tensions in the Middle East, and warnings from President Donald Trump that military options are at his disposal.

While Washington wants talks to include the nuclear program, ballistic missiles, support for armed groups and treatment of the Iranian people, Tehran has insisted on focusing exclusively on its disputed nuclear program and is seeking recognition of its right to enrich uranium.

item.title: Factbox-What is Islamic State, the group claiming responsibility for Pakistan attack?
item.description:
By Michael Georgy

Feb 6 (Reuters) - Islamic State on Friday claimed responsibility for an attack by a suicide bomber on a Shi'ite Muslim mosque in Islamabad that killed at least 31 people.

It was the deadliest attack of its kind in Pakistan's capital in more than a decade.

Here are some more details on the group.

WHAT IS ISLAMIC STATE?

The Sunni Muslim group emerged in Iraq and Syria and quickly created a "caliphate", declaring its rule over all Muslims and largely displacing al Qaeda.

item.title: Oman talks leave Israel unsure of Trump's endgame as missile threat persists
item.description: Israel and the United States are tightly coordinated on intelligence, but Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is apparently in the dark on President Donald Trump's intentions in Iran.

item.title: Turkey arrests two over alleged Mossad espionage ties: What to know
item.description: Turkish authorities accuse the suspects of providing intelligence for more than a decade, including technical data on communications equipment and attempting to infiltrate technological supply chains.

item.title: US troops pull out of Shaddadi base in Syria: What to know
item.description: The base has been a hub for American troops between the central city of Hasakah and the strategic Khabur River Valley, once the gateway to the Islamic State's oil-producing heartland.

item.title: Crypto crash collides with UAE’s big bet on digital assets
item.description: After hitting record highs in 2025, Bitcoin’s sell-off is roiling global markets and making waves in the UAE.

item.title: After Israel's FM visit, Iran defense chief in Azerbaijan, meets Aliyev
item.description: Iran and Azerbaijan remain at odds over the latter’s close ties with Israel in defense and energy.
